page.title: 12SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Social concerns. Some feel that the old village community spirit is disappearing. Many fear that this will be further undermined if more and more houses become holiday cottages. There is a fear amongst villagers in Nawton and Beadlam that the villages will become over-developed. Small orchards and pieces of open land are gradually being built on. A steady increase in the volume of traffic using the A170 through Nawton/ Beadlam is also of concern to the villagers who see it as a threat to peace and quiet. Another concern is the use of Wombleton Aerodrome for microlight flying. This is considered to be a great nuisance by some villagers.
